summary: Kissed the Girl and Made Her Cry
title: Kissed the Girl and Made Her Cry
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2KJI3RL

by TygraSol

A poem about falling in love, then letting them go, and all the pain that comes after and leaves you haunted by your past. Following the events of Star Wars Episode VIII: The Last Jedi.

Words: 156, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Star Wars Sequel Trilogy
  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Relationships: Rey/Ben Solo | Kylo Ren
  • Additional Tags: Post-Star Wars: The Last Jedi, Tragic Romance, Unrequited Love


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2KJI3RL

blog.name: iamghostwriter
blog.title:
#MakeComicsLikeThis
•Writing•Art•Real Hip Hop
blog.description: #PANEL SCIENTIFIX is an Evolving Experiment, Seeking where the Formula lies between mediocre & the MAGIC! My arsenal, the written word, the Panel, the Pen~Writing, Utilizing Multiple Methods of Storytelling, a Student of Infinity, absorbing every secret my mentors share, I continue to build the formula...at the same time, Networking with like-minded individuals, Collecting Interviews w/Writers/Artists/All those involved in the process of making great comics, literature, art, and music~Comic Industry News, Reviews, & Entertainment

title: It's Only a Paper Moon
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2KNFhLe

by gloriouswhisperstyphoon

Everyone has secrets, even happy memories can bring pain, and the war must still be fought.

Or: the effects of war on the Home Front, as seen through the eyes of the women of Bletchley Park over a single day during the War.

Words: 3105, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story (2016)
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Leia Organa, Winter Celchu, Shara Bey, Jyn Erso, Padmé Amidala, Mon Mothma, Cassian Andor
  • Relationships: Cassian Andor/Jyn Erso, Shara Bey/Kes Dameron
  • Additional Tags: Alternate Universe - World War II, Bletchley Park, Angst, The Author’s Musings on the Price of War


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2KNFhLe

summary: John Tyler Christopher Reveals His Next Star Was Action Figure Variant And It's A Wraparound
title: John Tyler Christopher Reveals His Next Star Was Action Figure Variant And It's A Wraparound
body:
John Tyler Christopher Reveals His Next Star Was Action Figure Variant And It’s A Wraparound

John Tyler Christopher has revealed his news Star Was Action Figure Variant for Star Wars #51 and it’s his first ever wraparound cover too, featuring everyone’s favourite bag of blubber, Jabba The Hutt.  As with all his variants, JTC will have this one available for pre-sale on his own website from the 23rd of August. You can check it out by clicking here.

The pre-sale starts at 6pm (EST) and…

View On WordPress

blog.name: iidigestive-readerii
blog.title: ii Digestive Reader ii
blog.description: (fanfiction.net username) ii Digestive Reader ii My content tag: Star Wars and...

body:
Star Wars and Korkie Kryze

All I need is someone - at some point - to say during the new season of Clone Wars “Obi-Wan left more than his cloak on Mandalore.”

“His heart?” Anakin asks, not quite understanding. “I know he loved your sister…”

Bo-Katan shook her head. “Something like that, General.”

She turns slightly, watching Obi-Wan talk animatedly with her nephew. It made her wonder what exactly happened on the year on the run, and what life would have been life if the pair had married.

Imagine that, she thinks. Satine alive and happy, her riddur by her side, a peaceful Mandalore. No war, no fighting. Just peace and some ginger ones running around their feet.

blog.name: mandowords
blog.title: Miit'alor
blog.description: I am a descriptivist linguist for the Mando'a language. I show what it can do, not what it MUST do. This is a place for discussion about Mando'a, and Mandalorian society and culture. Feel free to use the head cannons from this blog (or reblogged from others) in your RP or writing. All words and descriptions are taken from the mandoa.org Mandalorian Dictionary. Want to support this blog? Buy me a Kofi? OR buy some Mando'a themed items? Visit our Discord? Blog icon by Rina

summary:
by Tomas Pueyo Brochard
How can we use this to predict what happens in all 9 movies? Well, what happens in the first trilogies...
body:
The Star Wars Rings: The Hidden Structure Behind the Star Wars Story

by Tomas Pueyo Brochard

How can we use this to predict what happens in all 9 movies? Well, what happens in the first trilogies tells you what will happen the last one:

- i just want to point it out that kylo is not a sith but he is on the dark side

Here you can see how every 1st movie of every trilogy follows the same pattern. The same is true of 2nd and 3rd movies. We also know that the last movie needs to meet back where the 1st movie was.

Let’s see what we can guess about SW9.

In SW1, we start on the Light Side of the Force. The first trilogy is about the turnaround from Light to Dark Side. The Republic is replaced by the Empire. Jedi are replaced by Sith.

The second trilogy is about the comeback of the Light, destroying the Empire. But neither the Dark Side nor the Light prevailed.

At the beginning of the 3rd trilogy, we see both sides fighting it off, in a completely unbalanced universe.

So if you take a step back and look at the entire 9 movies, you see the pattern: first Light, then Dark, then they fight it off completely unbalanced… to find the balance. Does that remind you of something?

The first 6 movies are about Anakin: his “ring” is to go from Light to Darkness, (first trilogy) and back to Light (second trilogy). His story finished at the end of SW6. His ring is complete. That’s why, despite what Daniel Lowe is claiming, Anakin will not restore balance to the Force.

Luke’s Ring was compressed to the 2nd trilogy: from Light in SW4, to doubts in SW5 (tempted by his father and the Dark Side), to finally choosing the path of the Light in SW6.

For the 3rd trilogy, they decided to have him become the mentor: Obi-Wan’s role in the first trilogy and Yoda’s in the 2nd. Like Yoda, now Luke is out.

That leaves us with Rey and Kylo Ren. Unlike with the other 2 trilogies, this one is not about one single character at the center. That makes sense, because it’s not just Light becoming Darkness or Darkness being destroyed. This is about 2 forces completely unbalanced, trying to find their balance.

Rey is the Light Side. Kylo Ren is the Dark Side. Like the Light and Dark Sides coming together to find Balance, Rey and Kylo Ren need to merge to find the Balance in the force.

I think all reylos agree with conclusion and this is nothing new for us but I liked that rings structure as visual tool to understand se story.

Did you guys heard about this book or have any comments @clairen45 @toawaterfowl @postedbygaslight @raven-maiden @antbee17 @roxannepolice ?

Source: https://www.quora.com/What-do-you-suspect-will-happen-in-Star-Wars-Episode-9-having-seen-TLJ-Were-your-predictions-for-TLJ-correct

So if you take a step back and look at the entire 9 movies, you see the pattern: first Light, then Dark, then they fight it off completely unbalanced… to find the balance. Does that remind you of something?

The first 6 movies are about Anakin: his “ring” is to go from Light to Darkness, (first trilogy) and back to Light (second trilogy). His story finished at the end of SW6. His ring is complete. That’s why, despite what Daniel Lowe is claiming, Anakin will not restore balance to the Force.

Luke’s Ring was compressed to the 2nd trilogy: from Light in SW4, to doubts in SW5 (tempted by his father and the Dark Side), to finally choosing the path of the Light in SW6.

For the 3rd trilogy, they decided to have him become the mentor: Obi-Wan’s role in the first trilogy and Yoda’s in the 2nd. Like Yoda, now Luke is out.

That leaves us with Rey and Kylo Ren. Unlike with the other 2 trilogies, this one is not about one single character at the center. That makes sense, because it’s not just Light becoming Darkness or Darkness being destroyed. This is about 2 forces completely unbalanced, trying to find their balance.

Rey is the Light Side. Kylo Ren is the Dark Side. Like the Light and Dark Sides coming together to find Balance, Rey and Kylo Ren need to merge to find the Balance in the force.

I think all reylos agree with conclusion and this is nothing new for us but I liked that rings structure as visual tool to understand se story.
